name: GetWorkspaceProjects
description:
Fetch compact project records for a workspace.

This tool retrieves the compact project records for all projects in a specified workspace from Asana. It should be called when you need to access project information within a workspace. Note: May timeout for large domains; consider using the `/teams/{team_gid}/projects` endpoint for efficiency.

parameters.name: workspace_identifier
parameters.description: Globally unique identifier for the workspace or organization in Asana.

value_schema.description: Globally unique identifier for the workspace or organization.

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: Specify the number of project records to return per page. Must be between 1 and 100.

value_schema.description:
Results per page.
The number of objects to return per page. The value must be between 1 and 100.

parameters.name: pagination_offset_token
parameters.description: Offset token for pagination. Use to request subsequent pages. If omitted, returns the first page. Only use tokens from previous requests.

value_schema.description:
Offset token.
An offset to the next page returned by the API. A pagination request will return an offset token, which can be used as an input parameter to the next request. If an offset is not passed in, the API will return the first page of results.
*Note: You can only pass in an offset that was returned to you via a previously paginated request.*

parameters.name: optional_fields_to_include
parameters.description: Specify a list of property names to include in the response. These properties are not included by default.

value_schema.description: This endpoint returns a resource which excludes some properties by default. To include those optional properties, set this query parameter to a comma-separated list of the properties you wish to include.

parameters.name: enable_pretty_output
parameters.description: Enable pretty formatting for the response output. Use this for a readable JSON format, mainly during debugging.

value_schema.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

parameters.name: archived_projects_only
parameters.description: Specify `true` to return only archived projects, and `false` to include unarchived ones.

value_schema.description: Only return projects whose `archived` field takes on the value of this parameter.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the asana API.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Only return projects whose `archived` field takes on the value of this parameter.

value_schema.description: Only return projects whose `archived` field takes on the value of this parameter.
